page.title: 09PUTTING DRUMOAK ON THE MAP
page.content: THE TEA TOWEL The idea to make a Tea Towel about the area came from the Headmaster & PTA. Budding young artists from Drumoak School visited and drew places of local interest, Drum Castle, River Dee Drumoak School and animals common to our landscape.Some of the pictures were photo-copied to fit on a master copy of the towel showing well known places in and around our village and surrounded by a border of oak leaves. The master copy was sent to a firm who made a silk screen copy of the towel, used to print on white linen towels. The Tea Towels were then sold by the school and have been sent by parents and pupils to America, Africa, Australia and all over the world. Sales of Drumoak Tea Towels have raised about Â£400 for School Funds.
